text.author: Zodi, Basia Dajewski, Zach and others (see URL)
text.title: How to Get Rid of Mice Naturally
text.summary1: (human1) This guide to getting rid of mice at home naturally suggests keeping your home clean, storing food in airtight containers, applying peppermint oil on cotton balls near your garbage and doors or growing peppermint, using snake feces or ultrasonic beeping devices, or getting a cat or attracting birds of prey to your yard using a shelter box.
text.summary2: (human2) This section of a guide on how to get rid of mice provides tips for discouraging mice naturally, including keeping your home clean, applying peppermint oil, using dried snake feces, zapping mice with ultrasonic sounds, using a commercial, organic deterrent, getting a cat, putting trash cans far from your home, and promoting the nesting of birds of prey in your yard.
text.summary3: (human3) Advice for repelling and removing rodents from your home includes keeping a clean home by properly storing food and keeping trash outside the home, using peppermint oil, snake feces, ultrasonic sounds or commercially available deterrents to repel mice, and getting a cat or encouraging birds of prey to nest nearby to hunt the mice.
text.summary4: (human4) This section of a guide outlines methods for discouraging mice from your home naturally such as keeping your home clean, using peppermint oil, using dried snake feces, zapping mice with ultrasonic beeping sounds, using an organic deterrent, getting a cat, keeping trash far from your home, or promoting birds of prey like barn owls to nest in your yard.
text.summary5: (human5) This guide explains how to get rid of mice without chemical products, and recommends keeping food stored away, placing peppermint oil-infused cotton balls in the house, or dried snake feces, getting a good-mouser cat, using devices to emit ultrasounds or organic deterrents, moving the trash cans away from the home, and attracting birds of prey in the garden with a nesting box.
